trans-unit.source: Represents a restriction on a set of columns in which all values must be unique.
The <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> is enforced on a single column (or columns) to ensure that a primary key value is unique.
Constraints are not enforced unless the <xref:System.Data.DataSet.EnforceConstraints%2A> property is set to `true`.
When the a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> is merged with a second <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, constraints are not enforced until all merges are completed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to constrain.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the given array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to constrain, and a value specifying whether the constraint is a primary key.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to constrain.
`true` to indicate that the constraint is a primary key; otherwise, `false`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with an array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain, and a value specifying whether the constraint is a primary key.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain.
`true` to indicate that the constraint is a primary key; otherwise, `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name and <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>.
The name of the constraint.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to constrain.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name and array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The name of the constraint.
The array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name, the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to constrain, and a value specifying whether the constraint is a primary key.
The name of the constraint.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to constrain.
`true` to indicate that the constraint is a primary key; otherwise, `false`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name, an array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain, and a value specifying whether the constraint is a primary key.
The name of the constraint.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain.
`true` to indicate that the constraint is a primary key; otherwise, `false`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name, an array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain, and a value specifying whether the constraint is a primary key.
This constructor is provided for design time support in the Visual Studio .NET environment.
<xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> objects created by using this constructor must then be added to the collection via <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.AddRange%2A>.

Columns with the specified names must exist at the time the method is called, or if <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit%2A> has been called prior to calling this constructor, the columns with the specified names must exist at the time that <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit%2A> is called.
The name of the constraint.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to constrain.
`true` to indicate that the constraint is a primary key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the array of columns that this constraint affects.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
Compares this constraint to a second to determine if both are identical.
Two constraints are equal if they constrain the same columns.
The object to which this <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> is compared.
`true`, if the contraints are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the hash code of this instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> object.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Gets a value indicating whether or not the constraint is on a primary key.
A table usually includes a primary key that ensures every row is unique.
In some tables, the primary key may be made up of more than one column.
For example, a primary key for a table containing names might be made up of both the first and last names as well.
To create a primary key with more than one column, set the Columns property to an array of DataColumn objects.
`true`, if the constraint is on a primary key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the table to which this constraint belongs.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to which the constraint belongs.
